plot_points: Amelia grows up in a lighthouse with her father.
Amelia's father falls ill, leaving her in charge of the lighthouse.
Amelia takes up her father's mantle and keeps the light burning.
A fishing boat is lost at sea during a storm.
Amelia guides the boat to safety with the lighthouse light.
The villagers recognize Amelia's strength and bravery.
Amelia understands that the lighthouse is her legacy and her purpose.
Marcus is a recluse haunted by a past accident.
He receives a letter from a dying friend who wants to see one of his paintings.
He begins to paint, pouring his emotions into the canvas.
He realizes the painting is for himself as well as his friend.
He delivers the painting and witnesses its effect on his friend.
The art world recognizes his return, but he prioritizes personal healing over fame.

themes: The blurring of past and present
The allure and danger of the unknown
plot_points: Elena Reyes discovers an ancient manuscript.
Elena experiences strange occurrences while translating the manuscript.
Elena's colleagues urge her to stop, but she continues.
Elena vanishes after translating the final passage.
An archaeological dig reveals a mural depicting Elena as a high priestess.
